segment.source: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.

segment.source: You can also use the DISM image management command to list the image index numbers, to verify the architecture for the image that you are mounting, append an image, apply an image, capture an image and delete an image.
segment.target: You can also use the DISM image management command to list the image index numbers, to verify the architecture for the image that you are mounting, append an image, apply an image, capture an image and delete an image.

segment.source: After you update the image, you must unmount it and either commit or discard the changes that you have made.
segment.target: After you update the image, you must unmount it and either commit or discard the changes that you have made.

segment.source: This topic discusses DISM commands related to image management.
segment.target: This topic discusses DISM commands related to image management.

segment.source: To see other command-line options, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.
segment.target: To see other command-line options, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.

segment.source: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.
segment.target: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.

segment.source: In addition to the command-line tool, DISM is available by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: In addition to the command-line tool, DISM is available by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: The following commands can be used to mount, unmount, capture, append, and delete and query .wim, .vhd and .vhdx files.
segment.target: The following commands can be used to mount, unmount, capture, append, and delete and query .wim, .vhd and .vhdx files.

segment.source: These options are not case sensitive.
segment.target: These options are not case sensitive.

segment.source: /Append-Image
segment.target: /Append-Image

segment.source: Adds an additional image to a .wim file.
segment.target: Adds an additional image to a .wim file.

segment.source: /AppendImage compares new files to the resources in the existing .wim file specified by the /ImageFile argument, and stores only a single copy of each unique file so that each file is only captured once.
segment.target: /AppendImage compares new files to the resources in the existing .wim file specified by the /ImageFile argument, and stores only a single copy of each unique file so that each file is only captured once.

segment.source: The .wim file can have only one assigned compression type.
segment.target: The .wim file can have only one assigned compression type.

segment.source: Therefore, you can only append files with the same compression type.
segment.target: Therefore, you can only append files with the same compression type.

segment.source: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Ensure that you have enough disk space for the /Append-Image option to run.
segment.target: Ensure that you have enough disk space for the /Append-Image option to run.

segment.source: If you run out of disk space while the image is being appended, you might corrupt the .wim file.
segment.target: If you run out of disk space while the image is being appended, you might corrupt the .wim file.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /WIMBoot
segment.target: /WIMBoot

segment.source: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.
segment.target: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.

segment.source: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.
segment.target: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.

segment.source: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: /ConfigFile
segment.target: /ConfigFile

segment.source: specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.
segment.target: specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.

segment.source: /Bootable
segment.target: /Bootable

segment.source: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.
segment.target: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.

segment.source: This argument is available only for Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.
segment.target: This argument is available only for Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) images.

segment.source: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.
segment.target: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Verify
segment.target: /Verify

segment.source: Checks for errors and file duplication.
segment.target: Checks for errors and file duplication.

segment.source: /NoRpFix
segment.target: /NoRpFix

segment.source: Disables the reparse point tag fix.
segment.target: Disables the reparse point tag fix.

segment.source: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.
segment.target: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.

segment.source: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside of the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.
segment.target: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside of the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Apply-Image
segment.target: /Apply-Image

segment.source: For WIM, this command applies a Windows image file (.wim) or a split Windows image (.swm) files to a specified partition.
segment.target: For WIM, this command applies a Windows image file (.wim) or a split Windows image (.swm) files to a specified partition.

segment.source: For FFU, this command applies a full flash update (.ffu) image to a specified drive.
segment.target: For FFU, this command applies a full flash update (.ffu) image to a specified drive.

segment.source: It doesn’t support applying an image from a virtual hard disk (.vhdx) file, though you can use this command to apply a full image to a VHD.
segment.target: It doesn’t support applying an image from a virtual hard disk (.vhdx) file, though you can use this command to apply a full image to a VHD.

segment.source: FFU applies to Windows 10 only.
segment.target: FFU applies to Windows 10 only.

segment.source: This option doesn’t support applying an image from a virtual hard disk (VHD), though you can use this command to apply images to a .vhdx file that's been attached, partitioned, and formatted.
segment.target: This option doesn’t support applying an image from a virtual hard disk (VHD), though you can use this command to apply images to a .vhdx file that's been attached, partitioned, and formatted.

segment.source: Arguments for WIM:
segment.target: Arguments for WIM:

segment.source: Arguments for FFU
segment.target: Arguments for FFU

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Verify
segment.target: /Verify

segment.source: Checks for errors and file duplication.
segment.target: Checks for errors and file duplication.

segment.source: /NoRpFix
segment.target: /NoRpFix

segment.source: Disables the reparse point tag fix.
segment.target: Disables the reparse point tag fix.

segment.source: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.
segment.target: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.

segment.source: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.
segment.target: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.

segment.source: /SWMFile
segment.target: /SWMFile

segment.source: Enables you to reference split .wim files (SWMs).
segment.target: Enables you to reference split .wim files (SWMs).

segment.source: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.
segment.target: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.

segment.source: You can also specify wildcard characters.
segment.target: You can also specify wildcard characters.

segment.source: For example, "E:\image\install.swm" will apply all of the split files in the E:\image directory named install1.swm, install2.swm, and so on.
segment.target: For example, "E:\image\install.swm" will apply all of the split files in the E:\image directory named install1.swm, install2.swm, and so on.

segment.source: /ConfirmTrustedFile
segment.target: /ConfirmTrustedFile

segment.source: Validates the image for Trusted Desktop on a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8.
segment.target: Validates the image for Trusted Desktop on a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8.

segment.source: This option can only be run on a computer running at least WinPE 4.0.
segment.target: This option can only be run on a computer running at least WinPE 4.0.

segment.source: When using /Apply-Image with the /ConfirmTrustedFile option in WinPE, always specify the /ScratchDir option pointed to a physical media location.
segment.target: When using /Apply-Image with the /ConfirmTrustedFile option in WinPE, always specify the /ScratchDir option pointed to a physical media location.

segment.source: This ensures that short file names will always be available.
segment.target: This ensures that short file names will always be available.

segment.source: See DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax for more information about the default behavior of the /ScratchDir option.
segment.target: See DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax for more information about the default behavior of the /ScratchDir option.

segment.source: /WIMBoot
segment.target: /WIMBoot

segment.source: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.
segment.target: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.

segment.source: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.
segment.target: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.

segment.source: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: /Compact
segment.target: /Compact

segment.source: Applies an image in compact mode, saving drive space.
segment.target: Applies an image in compact mode, saving drive space.

segment.source: Replaces WIMBoot.
segment.target: Replaces WIMBoot.

segment.source: For Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.
segment.target: For Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.

segment.source: /ApplyDrive
segment.target: /ApplyDrive

segment.source: Specifies the logical drive, using the DeviceID.
segment.target: Specifies the logical drive, using the DeviceID.

segment.source: to get the device ID from the command line, type "wmic diskdrive list brief".
segment.target: to get the device ID from the command line, type "wmic diskdrive list brief".

segment.source: Note: a VHD may appear with the name “PhysicalDrive” in the description, for example, \PhysicalDrive2.
segment.target: Note: a VHD may appear with the name “PhysicalDrive” in the description, for example, \PhysicalDrive2.

segment.source: /SFUFile
segment.target: /SFUFile

segment.source: Use /SFUFile to reference split FFU files (SFUs).
segment.target: Use /SFUFile to reference split FFU files (SFUs).

segment.source: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.
segment.target: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.

segment.source: /SkipPlatformCheck
segment.target: /SkipPlatformCheck

segment.source: Use /SkipPlatformCheck if the FFU file being applied is targeted for a device other than the device performing the application.
segment.target: Use /SkipPlatformCheck if the FFU file being applied is targeted for a device other than the device performing the application.

segment.source: A special FFU file is required.
segment.target: A special FFU file is required.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: /Capture-CustomImage
segment.target: /Capture-CustomImage

segment.source: Captures the incremental file changes based on the specific install.wim file to a new file, custom.wim for a WIMBoot image.
segment.target: Captures the incremental file changes based on the specific install.wim file to a new file, custom.wim for a WIMBoot image.

segment.source: You can’t capture an empty directory.
segment.target: You can’t capture an empty directory.

segment.source: The captured files are converted to pointer files.
segment.target: The captured files are converted to pointer files.

segment.source: The custom.wim is placed in the same folder next to the install.wim.
segment.target: The custom.wim is placed in the same folder next to the install.wim.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: /Capture-CustomImage only captures the customization files.
segment.target: /Capture-CustomImage only captures the customization files.

segment.source: It can’t be used to capture installation files into a new WIM.
segment.target: It can’t be used to capture installation files into a new WIM.

segment.source: Keep the install.wim and custom.wim files together.
segment.target: Keep the install.wim and custom.wim files together.

segment.source: Don't switch out either the custom.wim file or the install.wim file.
segment.target: Don't switch out either the custom.wim file or the install.wim file.

segment.source: You can only capture the custom image once.
segment.target: You can only capture the custom image once.

segment.source: Don’t remove or recapture a custom.wim after capturing the incremental file changes.
segment.target: Don’t remove or recapture a custom.wim after capturing the incremental file changes.

segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.target: Description

segment.source: /CaptureDir
segment.target: /CaptureDir

segment.source: Specifies the directory to which the image was applied and customized.
segment.target: Specifies the directory to which the image was applied and customized.

segment.target: /ConfigFile

segment.source: Specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.
segment.target: Specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.

segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.target: /Verify

segment.source: Checks for errors and file duplication.

segment.source: [/ConfirmTrustedFile
segment.target: [/ConfirmTrustedFile

segment.source: Validates the image for Trusted Desktop on a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8.
segment.target: Validates the image for Trusted Desktop on a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8.

segment.source: This option can only be run on a computer running at least WinPE 4.0.
segment.target: This option can only be run on a computer running at least WinPE 4.0.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Capture-Image
segment.target: /Capture-Image

segment.source: Captures an image of a drive to a new .wim file.
segment.target: Captures an image of a drive to a new .wim file.

segment.source: Captured directories include all subfolders and data.
segment.target: Captured directories include all subfolders and data.

segment.source: You cannot capture an empty directory.
segment.target: You cannot capture an empty directory.

segment.source: A directory must contain at least one file.
segment.target: A directory must contain at least one file.

segment.source: You can capture the image as a Windows image (.wim) file or a set of split Windows image (.swm) files; this option doesn’t support capturing a virtual hard disk (.vhd/.vhdx) file or a full flash update (.ffu) image.
segment.target: You can capture the image as a Windows image (.wim) file or a set of split Windows image (.swm) files; this option doesn’t support capturing a virtual hard disk (.vhd/.vhdx) file or a full flash update (.ffu) image.

segment.source: Important DISM will ignore extended attributes during a capture operation.
segment.target: Important DISM will ignore extended attributes during a capture operation.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /ConfigFile
segment.target: /ConfigFile

segment.source: Specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.
segment.target: Specifies the location of a configuration file that lists exclusions for image capture and compress commands.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files.

segment.source: /Compress
segment.target: /Compress

segment.source: Specifies the type of compression used for the initial capture operation.
segment.target: Specifies the type of compression used for the initial capture operation.

segment.source: The maximum option provides the best compression, but takes more time to capture the image.
segment.target: The maximum option provides the best compression, but takes more time to capture the image.

segment.source: The fast option provides faster image compression, but the resulting files are larger than those compressed by using the maximum option.
segment.target: The fast option provides faster image compression, but the resulting files are larger than those compressed by using the maximum option.

segment.source: This is also the default compression type that is used if you do not specify the argument.
segment.target: This is also the default compression type that is used if you do not specify the argument.

segment.source: The none option does not compress the captured image at all.
segment.target: The none option does not compress the captured image at all.

segment.source: /Bootable
segment.target: /Bootable

segment.source: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.
segment.target: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.

segment.source: This argument is available only for WinPE images.
segment.target: This argument is available only for WinPE images.

segment.source: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.
segment.target: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Verify
segment.target: /Verify

segment.source: Checks for errors and file duplication.
segment.target: Checks for errors and file duplication.

segment.source: /NoRpFix
segment.target: /NoRpFix

segment.source: Disables the reparse point tag fix.
segment.target: Disables the reparse point tag fix.

segment.source: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.
segment.target: A reparse point is a file that contains a link to another file on the file system.

segment.source: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside of the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.
segment.target: If /NoRpFix is not specified, reparse points that resolve to paths outside of the value specified by /ImageFile will not be captured.

segment.source: /WIMBoot
segment.target: /WIMBoot

segment.source: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.
segment.target: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.

segment.source: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.
segment.target: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.

segment.source: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Cleanup-Mountpoints
segment.target: /Cleanup-Mountpoints

segment.source: Deletes all of the resources associated with a mounted image that has been corrupted.
segment.target: Deletes all of the resources associated with a mounted image that has been corrupted.

segment.source: This command will not unmount images that are already mounted, nor will it delete images that can be recovered using the /Remount-Imag command.
segment.target: This command will not unmount images that are already mounted, nor will it delete images that can be recovered using the /Remount-Imag command.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: To learn more, see Repair a Windows Image
segment.target: To learn more, see Repair a Windows Image

segment.source: /Commit-Image
segment.target: /Commit-Image

segment.source: Applies the changes that you have made to the mounted image.
segment.target: Applies the changes that you have made to the mounted image.

segment.source: The image remains mounted until the /Unmount-Image option is used.
segment.target: The image remains mounted until the /Unmount-Image option is used.

segment.target: Syntax:

segment.target: Parameter

segment.target: Description

segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Append
segment.target: /Append

segment.source: Adds the modified image to the existing .wim file instead of overwriting the original image.
segment.target: Adds the modified image to the existing .wim file instead of overwriting the original image.

segment.source: The /CheckIntegrity and /Append arguments do not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: The /CheckIntegrity and /Append arguments do not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Delete-Image
segment.target: /Delete-Image

segment.source: Deletes the specified volume image from a .wim file that has multiple volume images.
segment.target: Deletes the specified volume image from a .wim file that has multiple volume images.

segment.source: This option deletes only the metadata entries and XML entries.
segment.target: This option deletes only the metadata entries and XML entries.

segment.source: It does not delete the stream data and does not optimize the .wim file.
segment.target: It does not delete the stream data and does not optimize the .wim file.

segment.source: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Export-Image
segment.target: /Export-Image

segment.source: Exports a copy of the specified image to another file.
segment.target: Exports a copy of the specified image to another file.

segment.source: The source and destination files must use the same compression type.
segment.target: The source and destination files must use the same compression type.

segment.source: You can also optimize an image by exporting to a new image file.
segment.target: You can also optimize an image by exporting to a new image file.

segment.source: When you modify an image, DISM stores additional resource files that increase the overall size of the image.
segment.target: When you modify an image, DISM stores additional resource files that increase the overall size of the image.

segment.source: Exporting the image will remove unnecessary resource files.
segment.target: Exporting the image will remove unnecessary resource files.

segment.source: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /SWMFile
segment.target: /SWMFile

segment.source: Enables you to reference split .wim files.
segment.target: Enables you to reference split .wim files.

segment.source: pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.
segment.target: pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.

segment.source: You can also specify wildcard characters.
segment.target: You can also specify wildcard characters.

segment.source: For example, "E:\image\install*.swm" will export the split files in the E:\image directory named install1.swm, install2.swm, and so on.
segment.target: For example, "E:\image\install*.swm" will export the split files in the E:\image directory named install1.swm, install2.swm, and so on.

segment.source: /Compress
segment.target: /Compress

segment.source: Specifies the type of compression used for the initial capture operation.
segment.target: Specifies the type of compression used for the initial capture operation.

segment.source: The /Compress argument does not apply when you export an image to an existing .wim file, you can only use this argument when you export an image to a new .wim file.
segment.target: The /Compress argument does not apply when you export an image to an existing .wim file, you can only use this argument when you export an image to a new .wim file.

segment.source: The maximum option provides the best compression, but takes more time to capture the image.
segment.target: The maximum option provides the best compression, but takes more time to capture the image.

segment.source: The fast option provides faster image compression, but the resulting files are larger than those compressed by using the maximum option.
segment.target: The fast option provides faster image compression, but the resulting files are larger than those compressed by using the maximum option.

segment.source: This is also the default compression type that is used if you do not specify the argument.
segment.target: This is also the default compression type that is used if you do not specify the argument.

segment.source: Use the recovery option to export push-button reset images.
segment.target: Use the recovery option to export push-button reset images.

segment.source: The resulting files are much smaller in size, which in turn, greatly reduce the amount of disk space needed for saving the push-button reset image on a recovery drive.
segment.target: The resulting files are much smaller in size, which in turn, greatly reduce the amount of disk space needed for saving the push-button reset image on a recovery drive.

segment.source: The destination file must be specified with an .esd extension.
segment.target: The destination file must be specified with an .esd extension.

segment.source: The none option does not compress the captured image at all.
segment.target: The none option does not compress the captured image at all.

segment.source: /Bootable
segment.target: /Bootable

segment.source: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.
segment.target: Marks a volume image as being a bootable image.

segment.source: This argument is available only for WinPE images.
segment.target: This argument is available only for WinPE images.

segment.source: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.
segment.target: Only one volume image can be marked as bootable in a .wim file.

segment.source: /WIMBoot
segment.target: /WIMBoot

segment.source: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.
segment.target: Use /WIMBoot to append the image with Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) configuration.

segment.source: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.
segment.target: This only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.

segment.source: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: This feature isn't supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Get-MountedImageInfo
segment.target: /Get-MountedImageInfo

segment.source: Lists the images that are currently mounted and information about the mounted image such as whether the image is valid, read/write permissions, mount location, mounted file path, and mounted image index.
segment.target: Lists the images that are currently mounted and information about the mounted image such as whether the image is valid, read/write permissions, mount location, mounted file path, and mounted image index.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Get-ImageInfo
segment.target: /Get-ImageInfo

segment.source: Displays information about the images that are contained in the .wim, vhd or .vhdx file.
segment.target: Displays information about the images that are contained in the .wim, vhd or .vhdx file.

segment.source: When used with the /Index or /Name argument, information about the specified image is displayed, which includes if an image is a WIMBoot image, if the image is Windows 8.1, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM.
segment.target: When used with the /Index or /Name argument, information about the specified image is displayed, which includes if an image is a WIMBoot image, if the image is Windows 8.1, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM.

segment.source: The /Name argument does not apply to VHD files.
segment.target: The /Name argument does not apply to VHD files.

segment.source: You must specify /Index:1 for VHD files.
segment.target: You must specify /Index:1 for VHD files.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: /Get-WIMBootEntry
segment.target: /Get-WIMBootEntry

segment.source: Use /Get-WIMBootEntry to display WIMBoot configuration entries for the specified disk volume.
segment.target: Use /Get-WIMBootEntry to display WIMBoot configuration entries for the specified disk volume.

segment.source: For more information about how to display WIMBoot configuration entries, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information about how to display WIMBoot configuration entries, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM.

segment.source: This only applies to Windows 8.1; this feature isn't supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: This only applies to Windows 8.1; this feature isn't supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /List-Image
segment.target: /List-Image

segment.source: Displays a list of the files and folders in a specified image.
segment.target: Displays a list of the files and folders in a specified image.

segment.source: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: /Mount-Image
segment.target: /Mount-Image

segment.source: Mounts an image from a .wim, .vhd or .vhdx file to the specified directory so that it is available for servicing.
segment.target: Mounts an image from a .wim, .vhd or .vhdx file to the specified directory so that it is available for servicing.

segment.source: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify a .wim file.
segment.target: An index or name value is required for most operations that specify a .wim file.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /ReadOnly
segment.target: /ReadOnly

segment.source: Sets the mounted image with read-only permissions.
segment.target: Sets the mounted image with read-only permissions.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: /Optimize
segment.target: /Optimize

segment.source: Reduces initial mount time.
segment.target: Reduces initial mount time.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: /Optimize-Image /WIMBoot
segment.target: /Optimize-Image /WIMBoot

segment.source: Performs specified configurations to an offline image.
segment.target: Performs specified configurations to an offline image.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /WIMBoot
segment.target: /WIMBoot

segment.source: configure an offline image for installing on a Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) system.
segment.target: configure an offline image for installing on a Windows image file boot (WIMBoot) system.

segment.source: /Optimize
segment.target: /Optimize

segment.source: Reduces initial mount time.
segment.target: Reduces initial mount time.

segment.source: /Optimize-Image /WIMBoot only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.
segment.target: /Optimize-Image /WIMBoot only applies to Windows 8.1 images that have been captured or exported as a WIMBoot file.

segment.source: Only use /Optimize-Image with images that will be used for WIMBoot supported systems.
segment.target: Only use /Optimize-Image with images that will be used for WIMBoot supported systems.

segment.source: If /Optimize-Image is used with a non-WIMBoot supported system image, Windows may not work as expected, after installation on a non-WIMBoot supported device.
segment.target: If /Optimize-Image is used with a non-WIMBoot supported system image, Windows may not work as expected, after installation on a non-WIMBoot supported device.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Remount-Image
segment.target: /Remount-Image

segment.source: Remounts a mounted image that has become inaccessible and makes it available for servicing.
segment.target: Remounts a mounted image that has become inaccessible and makes it available for servicing.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Split-Image
segment.target: /Split-Image

segment.source: For WIM, this command splits an existing .wim file into multiple read-only split .swm files.
segment.target: For WIM, this command splits an existing .wim file into multiple read-only split .swm files.

segment.source: This option creates the .swm files in the specified directory, naming each file the same as the specified path_to_swm, but with an appended number.
segment.target: This option creates the .swm files in the specified directory, naming each file the same as the specified path_to_swm, but with an appended number.

segment.source: For example, if you set path_to_swm as , this option creates a Data.swm file, a Data2.swm file, a Data3.swm file, and so on, defining each portion of the split .wim file and saving it to the C:\ directory.
segment.target: For example, if you set path_to_swm as , this option creates a Data.swm file, a Data2.swm file, a Data3.swm file, and so on, defining each portion of the split .wim file and saving it to the C:\ directory.

segment.source: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: This command-line option does not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: For FFU, this command splits an existing full-flash update (.ffu) file into multiple read-only split .sfu files.
segment.target: For FFU, this command splits an existing full-flash update (.ffu) file into multiple read-only split .sfu files.

segment.source: The /Split-Ffu option applies only to Windows 10 for desktop editions.
segment.target: The /Split-Ffu option applies only to Windows 10 for desktop editions.

segment.source: This option creates the .sfu files in the specified directory, naming each file the same as the specified /SFUFile, but with an appended number.
segment.target: This option creates the .sfu files in the specified directory, naming each file the same as the specified /SFUFile, but with an appended number.

segment.source: For example, if you use , you'll get a flash.sfu file, a flash2.ffu file, a flash3.sfu file, and so on, defining each portion of the split .sfu file and saving it to the C:\ directory.
segment.target: For example, if you use , you'll get a flash.sfu file, a flash2.ffu file, a flash3.sfu file, and so on, defining each portion of the split .sfu file and saving it to the C:\ directory.

segment.target: Syntax for WIM:

segment.target: Syntax for FFU:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /FileSize
segment.target: /FileSize

segment.source: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) for each created file.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) for each created file.

segment.source: If a single file is larger than the value specified in the /FileSize option, one of the split .swm files that results will be larger than the value specified in the /FileSize option, in order to accommodate the large file.
segment.target: If a single file is larger than the value specified in the /FileSize option, one of the split .swm files that results will be larger than the value specified in the /FileSize option, in order to accommodate the large file.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /ImageFile
segment.target: /ImageFile

segment.source: Specifies the path of a .FFU file, example: flash.ffu.
segment.target: Specifies the path of a .FFU file, example: flash.ffu.

segment.source: /SFUFile
segment.target: /SFUFile

segment.source: References split FFU files (SFUs).
segment.target: References split FFU files (SFUs).

segment.source: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.
segment.target: Pattern is the naming pattern and location of split files.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: /Unmount-Image
segment.target: /Unmount-Image

segment.source: Unmounts the .wim, .vhd or .vhdx file and either commits or discards the changes that were made when the image was mounted.
segment.target: Unmounts the .wim, .vhd or .vhdx file and either commits or discards the changes that were made when the image was mounted.

segment.source: You must use either the /commit or /discard argument when you use the /Unmount-Image option.
segment.target: You must use either the /commit or /discard argument when you use the /Unmount-Image option.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity

segment.source: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.
segment.target: Detects and tracks .wim file corruption when used with capture, unmount, export, and commit operations.

segment.source: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.
segment.target: /CheckIntegrity stops the operation if DISM detects that the .wim file is corrupted when used with apply and mount operations.

segment.source: /Append
segment.target: /Append

segment.source: Adds the modified image to the existing .wim file instead of overwriting the original image.
segment.target: Adds the modified image to the existing .wim file instead of overwriting the original image.

segment.source: The /CheckIntegrity and /Append arguments do not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.
segment.target: The /CheckIntegrity and /Append arguments do not apply to virtual hard disk (VHD) files.

segment.source: /Update-WIMBootEntry
segment.target: /Update-WIMBootEntry

segment.source: Updates the WIMBoot configuration entry, associated with the specified data source ID, with the renamed image file or moved image file path.
segment.target: Updates the WIMBoot configuration entry, associated with the specified data source ID, with the renamed image file or moved image file path.

segment.source: Note /Update-WIMBootEntry requires a restart in order for any updates to take effect.
segment.target: Note /Update-WIMBootEntry requires a restart in order for any updates to take effect.

segment.source: Syntax:
segment.target: Syntax:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /Path
segment.target: /Path

segment.source: Specifies the disk volume of the WIMBoot configuration.
segment.target: Specifies the disk volume of the WIMBoot configuration.

segment.source: /DataSourceID
segment.target: /DataSourceID

segment.source: Specifies the data source ID as displayed by /Get-WIMBootEntry.
segment.target: Specifies the data source ID as displayed by /Get-WIMBootEntry.
